reporter_caption.center: MERIT DECISIONS WITH OPINIONS, Unpublished Decision (8-6-2003)

date.center: Case Announcements and Administrative Actions August 6, 2003

opinion_text.unpublished:
[EDITOR'S NOTE: This case is unpublished as indicated by the issuing court.] 2002-0242. State v. Brown, 2003-Ohio-3931.
Montgomery App. No. 18972, 2001-Ohio-7073. Judgment affirmed.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer and Kline, JJ., concur.
Lundberg Stratton and O'Connor, JJ., dissent.
Roger L. Kline, J., of the Fourth Appellate District, sitting for Cook, J.
2002-0984. Bosher v. Euclid Income Tax Bd. of Review,2003-Ohio-3886.
Cuyahoga App. No. 80240, 2002-Ohio-2671. Judgment affirmed.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O'Connor and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
2002-1632. State ex rel. Hammer v. Indus. Comm., 2003-Ohio-3960.
Franklin App. No. 01AP-1315, 2002-Ohio-4294. Judgment affirmed.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O'Connor and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
2003-0085. State ex rel. Commt. for the Referendum of Ord. No.3844-02 v. Norris, 2003-Ohio-3887.
In Mandamus. Writ denied.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O'Connor and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
2003-0698. Akron Bar Assn. v. Goodlet, 2003-Ohio-3935.
On Certified Report by the Board of Commissioners on Grievances and Discipline of the Supreme Court, No. 02-14. C. William Goodlet is suspended from the practice of law in Ohio for one year, with the entire suspension stayed on conditions.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
O'Connor, J., not participating.
2003-0700. Cincinnati Bar Assn. v. Al'Uqdah, 2003-Ohio-3888.
On Certified Report by the Board of Commissioners on Grievances and Discipline, No. 01-29.
William M. Al'Uqdah is permanently disbarred.
Moyer, C.J., Resnick, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O'Connor and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
F.E. Sweeney, J., dissents and would indefinitely suspend respondent.
2003-0725. Disciplinary Counsel v. Herman, 2003-Ohio-3932.
On Certified Report by the Board of Commissioners on Grievances and Discipline of the Supreme Court, No. 02-18.
John Herman is suspended from the practice of law in Ohio for one year, with six months stayed on condition.
Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton and O'Donnell, JJ., concur.
Moyer, C.J., and O'Connor, J., dissent and would suspend respondent from the practice of law for one year and stay no portion of the suspension.
